meanings.definition: To anticipate with fear or anxiety.
meanings.sent1: She was dreading the dentist appointment.
meanings.sent2: I am dreading the upcoming test.
meanings.sent3: He was dreading the surprise party, not knowing what to expect.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds looming overhead made her feel like she was dreading a storm.
meanings.sent5: The eerie silence in the house had her dreading every creak and groan.

meanings.definition: To fear something that will or might happen.
meanings.sent1: The hiker was dreading encountering a bear in the woods.
meanings.sent2: She is dreading the possibility of losing her job.
meanings.sent3: He was dreading the thought of having to wear a costume to the party.
meanings.sent4: The student was dreading the moment the teacher would announce the pop quiz.
meanings.sent5: The driver was dreading the sound of the engine sputtering on the deserted road.
